resources.string: To use the app, you need to download the BetaMidrash library. Do you want to do this now?\nYou can always click \'Update Library\' in settings to update.
Do you want to download the new Sefaria library now?\nYou can always tap \'Update Library\' in settings to update.
You need internet in order to download the update. Try again later.
You are using mobile data (not WIFI). The update is about 100MB. Do you want to download it anyways?
You don\'t have internet to download the library. You can install it manually when you have internet by going to Settings and tapping \'Update Library\'.
There is no new update to download. Try again later.

Your library is downloading and installing. This should only take a few minutes. If it is taking longer than 5-10 minutes after downloading, which should also only be a few minutes, then cancel update (and it most likely worked).
The update cannot be canceled at this point. Please wait for it to finish.
Go through the help dialogs to learn about the app
Please try to update again when you have internet
Your phone doesn\'t have enough space to store the entire library
Upgrade to the newest version of
Update is still setting up. Wait a moment to cancel.
BetaMidrash is created and owned by Josh Herzberg, jherzberg@torahsummary.com, and Noah Santacruz, noahssantacruz@gmail.com.

BetaMidrash is revolutionizing the mobile Torah learning experience and has one of largest libraries of Torah texts on a mobile device, with tens of thousands of English translations, and half a million connections between the texts. With a user friendly design, easy jumping between connected sources, and advanced searching to help you find what you\'re looking for quickly, it is one best places to study Torah on the go.

Our library is from Sefaria.org , with slight modifications. Sefaria is breaking grounds in the world of digitized Jewish texts. It is an open source library, so if you want to add translations or books, the power is in your hands. They check the accuracy of the content, making have the most accurate Talmud text freely available on the internet, using the Vilna shas as the standard. One of the things that makes Sefaria so unique is that all their texts are copyright free and open for anyone to use for any purpose. BetaMidrash isn\'t part of the Sefaria project, but Sefaria\'s openness enables us to use the Torah.
For any bugs, problems, or suggestions please feel free to email us. If you enjoy BetaMidrash, don\'t forget to rate it on the play store.
Creating the world\'s most powerful mobile Torah App doesn\'t happen overnight. It takes lots of time and resources. You can find out more at BetaMidrash.org. Thank you so much and enjoy your torah.
Error Parsing Query - trying nikudah dependent search.
I\'m sorry, but this version has been discontinued.
There was a problem writing file. Please check app permissions.
No Bookmarks.\nTo add, go to any text and tap the star icon.
(Note: Nekudot are not fully supported on your version of Android)
Hebrew and English side by side
You can search in Hebrew or English.
English will only return texts containing the exact expression (case insensitive).
Hebrew will return texts which contain all of the searched words (irrelevant of their location in the text). It ignores leading vavs (כל will also return וכל).
For advanced search use _ as single character and % as zero or more characters.
For example: b_g returns texts with big or bag. Name % city returns texts like name of the city. %ברא returns texts with בראם or בראשון. And כלי_ returns texts with הכלי or בכלי.
If you\'re looking for something in Gemara or Chumash askjosh@torahsummary.com might be able to help.
Are you sure you want to cancel?
Are you sure you want to cancel? Your update might need to be restarted.
